abstract: Does Roger Goodell risk the appearance of two standards of justice in his league, one for coaches and one for players?
snippet: Does Roger Goodell risk the appearance of two standards of justice in his league, one for coaches and one for players?
lead_paragraph: It's hard to argue with this line of reasoning from Michael Silver of Yahoo Sports:

headline.main: By Not Fining Coaches, N.F.L. Leaves Itself Open to Charges of Hypocrisy
